title: use_repo_rule can use private repository rules

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

body:
### Description of the bug:


It's possible to create private repository rules (whose names start with an underscore) and use them via use_repo_rule. Probably that shouldn't be allowed.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Rules API

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


def.bzl:

```starlark
def _foo_impl(ctx):
    ctx.file("BUILD.bazel", 'exports_files(["foo.txt"])')
    ctx.file("foo.txt", "hello world")

_foo = repository_rule(implementation = _foo_impl)
```

MODULE.bazel:

```starlark
foo = use_repo_rule("//:def.bzl", "_foo")
foo(name = "foo")
```

BUILD.bazel:

```starlark
genrule(
    name = "bar",
    srcs = ["@foo//:foo.txt"],
    outs = ["bar.txt"],
    cmd = "cp $< $@",
)
```

Building this repository will succeed even though the `_foo` repository rule is private (and Buildifier complains that it's unused).

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


macOS 15.3.1
